title: What are the specifications of the Raspberry Pi 4? - Quora

response.answer_text: The new Raspberry Pi 4 was released on June 24, 2019. Specifications as Broadcom BCM2711, Quad core Cortex-A72 (ARM v8) 64-bit SoC @ 1.5GHz1GB, 2GB or 4GB LPDDR4-2400 SDRAM (depending on model)2.4 GHz and 5.0 GHz IEEE 802.11ac wireless, Bluetooth 5.0, BLEGigabit Ethernet2 USB 3.0 ports; 2 USB 2.0 ports.Raspberry Pi standard 40 pin GPIO header (fully backwards compatible with previous boards)2 × micro-HDMI ports (up to 4kp60 supported)2-lane MIPI DSI display port2-lane MIPI CSI camera port4-pole stereo audio and composite video portH.265 (4kp60 decode), H264 (1080p60 decode, 1080p30 encode)OpenGL ES 3.0 graphicsMicro-SD card slot for loading operating system and data storage5V DC via USB-C connector (minimum 3A*)5V DC via GPIO header (minimum 3A*)Power over Ethernet (PoE) enabled (requires separate PoE HAT)Operating temperature: 0 – 50 degrees C ambient* A good quality 2.5A power supply can be used if downstream USB peripherals consume less than 500mA in total. Check out our detailed review and join our FREE RPi4 giveaway (includes free international shipping!) here -> The Raspberry Pi 4 Ultimate Review - yodeck

Benchmarking the Raspberry Pi 4 - Gareth Halfacree - Medium It’s almost twice as fast compared to the previous version (3 B+) and a good desktop replacement for regular use like email, browsing, spreadsheets and of course with the dual 4k micro HDMI, entertainment. What seals the deal for me - 4GB LPDDR4 vs 1GB LPDDR2 [Faster and higher capacity memory]USB 3.0 vs USB 2.0 [Faster transfer speeds]28nm SoC vs 40nm SoC [Less power and heat, better perfomance]H.265 4Kp60 decoding vs 	H.264 1080p30 [Fabulous performance]Looking at the benchmarks (Linpack etc) the current RPi4 is comparable to few years old Pentium 4, in terms of speed and throughput, though I would compare this entry - medium level laptops considering the video decoding capabilities.
